lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Arin.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Arin.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents the main chatbot application, Arin.
* It manages user interactions, executes commands, and maintains task data.
* Initializes the chatbot with the specified storage file path.
* @param filePath The file path for storing task data.
* Runs the chatbot, handling user commands in a loop until exit is requested.
* Represents a custom exception for the Arin chatbot.
* Constructs an ArinException with the given message.
* Represents a command that adds a task (ToDo, Deadline, Event).
* Creates a command to add the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added.
public void execute(final TaskList taskList, final Ui ui, final Storage storage) throws ArinException {
* Represents a generic command that can be executed.
* Executes the command with the given task list, UI, and storage.
* @param taskList The task list to operate on.
* @param ui       The UI to interact with the user.
* @param storage  The storage to save any changes.
* @throws ArinException If execution encounters an issue.
void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ArinException;
* Determines whether this command will exit the application.
* @return true if the command should exit the application, false otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Creates a command to delete the task at the specified index.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to delete.
* Executes the command to delete the task from the task list,
* display the deletion, and save the updated task list.
* @param taskList The task list to remove the task from.
* @param ui       The UI to display messages to the user.
* @param storage  The storage to save the updated task list.
* @throws ArinException If there is an error deleting the task.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ArinException {
* Indicates whether this command should cause the application to exit.
* @return false as this command does not exit the application.
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* Executes the command to display an exit message to the user.
* @param taskList The task list (not used in this command).
* @param ui       The UI to display messages to the user.
* @param storage  The storage (not used in this command).
* @throws ArinException Never thrown in this command.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ArinException {
* Indicates that this command should cause the application to exit.
* @return true as this command exits the application.
* Represents a command to find tasks that match a keyword.
* Creates a FindCommand with a keyword to search for.
* @param keyword The keyword to search in task descriptions.
* Executes the find command to search for tasks containing the keyword.
* @param taskList The task list to search.
* @param ui       The UI to display matching tasks.
* @param storage  The storage (not used in this command).
* @throws ArinException If an error occurs during execution.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ArinException {
* Indicates whether this command should cause the application to exit.
* @return false as this command does not exit the application.
* Represents a command to list all tasks in the task list.
* Executes the command to display all tasks in the task list.
* @param taskList The task list to be displayed.
* @param ui       The UI to display messages to the user.
* @param storage  The storage (not used in this command).
* @throws ArinException If there is an error during execution.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ArinException {
* Indicates whether this command should cause the application to exit.
* @return false as this command does not exit the application.
* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* Creates a command to mark the task at the specified index as done.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to mark as done.
* Executes the command to mark the specified task as done,
* display the change, and save the updated task list.
* @param taskList The task list containing the task.
* @param ui       The UI to display messages to the user.
* @param storage  The storage to save the updated task list.
* @throws ArinException If there is an error marking the task as done.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ArinException {

* @return false as this command does not exit the application.
* Handles loading and saving tasks to a file.
* Creates a Storage object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored.

* @return An ArrayList of tasks loaded from the file.
System.out.println("File not found, starting with an empty list.");
* Saves the given list of tasks to a file.

* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by The due date in "yyyy-MM-dd" format.
* Represents an event task that has a start and end time.

* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start time in "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm" format.
* @param to The end time in "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm" format.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* Parses the "deadline" command and returns an AddTaskCommand.

* @throws ArinException If the command format is incorrect.
private static Command parseDeadlineCommand(String[] commandParts) throws ArinException {
throw new ArinException("Invalid deadline format! Use: deadline <task> /by <due date>");
throw new ArinException("Invalid deadline format! Use: deadline <task> /by <due date>");
* Parses the "event" command and returns an AddTaskCommand.
* @param commandParts The parts of the command split by spaces.
* @return An AddTaskCommand for the event task.
* @throws ArinException If the command format is incorrect.
private static Command parseEventCommand(String[] commandParts) throws ArinException {
throw new ArinException("Invalid event format! Use: event <task> /from <start time> /to <end time>");
throw new ArinException("Invalid event format! Use: event <task> /from <start time> /to <end time>");
return new AddTaskCommand(new Event(eventParts[0], eventParts[1], eventParts[2]));
* Handles user interactions and displays messages.
* Creates a Ui object for handling user input and output.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Reads a command input from the user.
* @return The user input as a string.
* Displays a horizontal line as a separator.
* Displays an error message to the user.
* @param message The error message to display.
* Displays a message indicating a task has been added.
* @param task The task that was added.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
* Displays a message indicating a task has been deleted.
* Displays the exit message when the program is closing.
System.out.println("Goodbye! Hope to see you again soon.");
* Displays a message indicating a task has been marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays a task to the user.
* @param task The task to be displayed.

* @param matchingTasks The list of tasks matching the search query.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");

assertTrue(output.contains("What can I do for you?"));

* Tests execution of FindCommand when no tasks match.
